description: The Microsoft Excel 2016 episodes will give you a fundamental understanding of the Excel environment, and demonstrate the correct application of the principal features of Excel 2016. These episodes cover how to create and edit worksheets and workbooks with multiple sheets, working with cells and ranges, creating tables, applying formulas and functions, and creating charts and objects.
name: Excel 2016 - Level 1
subtitle: Spreadsheet application

episodes.description: The Microsoft Excel 2016 episodes will give you a fundamental understanding of the Excel environment, and demonstrate the correct application of the principal features of Excel 2016. These episodes cover how to create and edit worksheets and workbooks with multiple sheets, working with cells and ranges, creating tables, applying formulas and functions, and creating charts and objects.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:09.558
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:09.558 --> 00:00:13.159
Hello, we're here to introduce you to
a new series that we're beginning on

3
00:00:13.159 --> 00:00:14.520
Microsoft Excel 2016.

4
00:00:14.520 --> 00:00:18.110
I'm here with Mike Roderick
who's gonna help us

5
00:00:18.110 --> 00:00:20.070
understand what we'll be
learning in this series.

6
00:00:20.070 --> 00:00:23.160
Mike Yeah,
we're gonna be covering Excel from top

7
00:00:23.160 --> 00:00:25.780
to bottom really from a couple
different perspectives.

8
00:00:25.780 --> 00:00:28.990
These videos that we're getting ready
to shoot are gonna help those of you

9
00:00:28.990 --> 00:00:31.030
that are getting started in Excel.

10
00:00:31.030 --> 00:00:32.760
Maybe you've gotten a new job and

11
00:00:32.760 --> 00:00:37.140
you need to learn how to use Excel because
it's part of your job requirements.

12
00:00:37.140 --> 00:00:40.340
We're also gonna be covering a lot
of the objectives that are for

13
00:00:40.340 --> 00:00:41.550
the Microsoft exam.

14
00:00:41.550 --> 00:00:46.340
You can go out and get certified in Excel
to prove your knowledge to your employer.

15
00:00:46.340 --> 00:00:50.740
So we're gonna hit it from both angles
there, trying to cover everybody's needs.

16
00:00:50.740 --> 00:00:51.920
And we're gonna cover,

17
00:00:51.920 --> 00:00:55.690
these are basically the first series
of videos that we're gonna do.

18
00:00:55.690 --> 00:00:59.070
We're gonna start with the basics,
we're gonna learn how to simply create

19
00:00:59.070 --> 00:01:03.270
worksheets and workbooks and
navigate around that user interface so

20
00:01:03.270 --> 00:01:06.070
that I feel comfortable
Working with Excel.

21
00:01:06.070 --> 00:01:11.010
We're gonna look at inserting
things like hyperlinks and

22
00:01:11.010 --> 00:01:14.330
changing worksheet order and
coloring tabs.

23
00:01:14.330 --> 00:01:17.170
We'll move on then from that
to formatting our worksheets.

24
00:01:17.170 --> 00:01:21.430
Once I've got that data inserted into a
worksheet, I've gotta make it presentable

25
00:01:21.430 --> 00:01:24.800
so I can turn in back in to my
superiors or take it to a meeting.

26
00:01:24.800 --> 00:01:26.490
How do I make it look good, right?

27
00:01:26.490 --> 00:01:28.860
How do I get my columns lined up right?

28
00:01:28.860 --> 00:01:32.770
How do I get the text, the right font and
underlined, or what have you.

29
00:01:32.770 --> 00:01:34.210
We're gonna cover all of that.

30
00:01:34.210 --> 00:01:37.040
We're gonna look at things like
data validation to make sure that

31
00:01:37.040 --> 00:01:41.570
when data is entered into this worksheet,
that it's in the correct format.

32
00:01:41.570 --> 00:01:46.590
We're gonna take a look at different
options and views that we can configure.

33
00:01:46.590 --> 00:01:49.630
Hiding worksheets,
hiding columns and rows,

34
00:01:51.010 --> 00:01:55.930
we're gonna take a brief look at macros,
recording some simple macros that allow me

35
00:01:55.930 --> 00:02:00.750
to automate some of my routine tasks
that I have to do and then we're gonna

36
00:02:00.750 --> 00:02:05.130
take a look at how we can print workbooks
and how we cans ave those workbooks and

37
00:02:05.130 --> 00:02:08.530
make sure that they're available for
other people to access.

38
00:02:08.530 --> 00:02:09.670
Or if I need a hard copy,

39
00:02:09.670 --> 00:02:12.910
how do I print just this one
worksheet out of this workbook?

40
00:02:12.910 --> 00:02:16.190
Or how do I print a specific
area of a worksheet?

41
00:02:16.190 --> 00:02:19.760
And then we're gonna dive
into formatting cells, right?

42
00:02:19.760 --> 00:02:24.350
Making sure that currency is formatted
with a dollar sign and decimal points and

43
00:02:24.350 --> 00:02:26.680
that dates show up properly.

44
00:02:26.680 --> 00:02:30.970
We'll take a look at creating groups and
outlines to summarize our data and

45
00:02:30.970 --> 00:02:33.970
give us that summary
information that we need.

46
00:02:33.970 --> 00:02:38.722
We also take a look at things like
sparklines and charts and inserting

47
00:02:38.722 --> 00:02:44.375
smart art and other objects that gives me
the visual representation for the data.

48
00:02:44.375 --> 00:02:48.795
They give me another way to look at it
that make it possible to spot trends and

49
00:02:48.795 --> 00:02:50.695
anomalies in my data.

50
00:02:50.695 --> 00:02:53.525
Also taking a look at tables, right?

51
00:02:53.525 --> 00:02:58.455
Tables are a great part of Excel,
a great way to organize my data,

52
00:02:58.455 --> 00:03:01.375
filter my data, sort my data.

53
00:03:01.375 --> 00:03:04.065
And then we take a look at functions,
of course.

54
00:03:04.065 --> 00:03:06.835
Because that's gonna be a big
part of working with Excel.

55
00:03:06.835 --> 00:03:09.340
We can put these raw numbers in there, but

56
00:03:09.340 --> 00:03:13.480
I need to be able to figure out sums and
averages and counts.

57
00:03:13.480 --> 00:03:14.960
We're gonna cover all that for you.

58
00:03:14.960 --> 00:03:19.677
So, if you are in a position where you
need to use Excel as part of your everyday

59
00:03:19.677 --> 00:03:24.468
job or if you're studying up to take one
of those Microsoft specialist exams,

60
00:03:24.468 --> 00:03:26.806
these are gonna be the videos for you.

61
00:03:26.806 --> 00:03:33.229
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: The Microsoft Excel 2016 episodes will give you a fundamental understanding of the Excel environment, and demonstrate the correct application of the principal features of Excel 2016. These episodes cover how to create and edit worksheets and workbooks with multiple sheets, working with cells and ranges, creating tables, applying formulas and functions, and creating charts and objects.
episodes.title: Introduction to Excel 2016
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.172 --> 00:00:10.172
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.793 --> 00:00:15.718
Welcome to another exciting
episode right here on ITPro TV.

3
00:00:15.718 --> 00:00:17.134
I'm your host, Ronnie Wong.

4
00:00:17.134 --> 00:00:20.976
And today, we're gonna be talking
about working with Excel 2016.

5
00:00:20.976 --> 00:00:23.389
Now, when we talk about
working with Excel 2016,

6
00:00:23.389 --> 00:00:26.746
a lot of times this is one of the main
business applications that we tend to see

7
00:00:26.746 --> 00:00:28.790
just about on every single computer.

8
00:00:28.790 --> 00:00:30.855
Because it actually is so
diverse, there's so

9
00:00:30.855 --> 00:00:32.669
many different things you can do with it.

10
00:00:32.669 --> 00:00:35.080
And to help us out is
gonna be Mr Mike Rodrick.

11
00:00:35.080 --> 00:00:36.349
Mike let's say for example,

12
00:00:36.349 --> 00:00:39.304
that what we have is that we have
a new business that we're starting.

13
00:00:39.304 --> 00:00:42.960
And one of the main applications that we
wanna use to help keep track of everything

14
00:00:42.960 --> 00:00:44.930
is gonna be something like Excel.

15
00:00:44.930 --> 00:00:48.060
So Mike, where's the best place that
we can get started if we really aren't

16
00:00:48.060 --> 00:00:49.230
familiar with Excel?

17
00:00:49.230 --> 00:00:52.355
>> That's a great question Ronnie and
it's a very good scenario.

18
00:00:52.355 --> 00:00:55.340
That's a very typical thing to see,
especially in your smaller businesses.

19
00:00:55.340 --> 00:00:57.738
And again, even in your big businesses,

20
00:00:57.738 --> 00:01:00.760
Excel is an application
that gets used constantly.

21
00:01:00.760 --> 00:01:03.890
Cuz it is so powerful, and it is so
good at crunching numbers and

22
00:01:03.890 --> 00:01:05.196
keeping track of things.

23
00:01:05.196 --> 00:01:08.143
It's just under a data.

24
00:01:08.143 --> 00:01:10.999
It's not a relational database engine,
it's not a database.

25
00:01:10.999 --> 00:01:14.575
But it sure does come close with some
of the cool techniques we can do.

26
00:01:14.575 --> 00:01:17.152
And we're gonna explore all of
those throughout these episodes.

27
00:01:17.152 --> 00:01:21.267
But if we're just getting started, then
the first thing we need to make sure we do

28
00:01:21.267 --> 00:01:23.759
is we can launch the application and
get around.

29
00:01:23.759 --> 00:01:27.857
Get our feet wet, kinda dive in
explore the application itself.

30
00:01:27.857 --> 00:01:31.898
It's something that I always recommend to
people when you first get an application

31
00:01:31.898 --> 00:01:34.392
or you're first getting
exposed to some program.

32
00:01:34.392 --> 00:01:36.272
Just go in there and
click around for a little bit.

33
00:01:36.272 --> 00:01:39.570
Just look around,
see what things you have and explore.

34
00:01:39.570 --> 00:01:42.333
So, that's what we're gonna do
in this particular episode.

35
00:01:42.333 --> 00:01:46.410
So on my computer here,
I've got Excel 2016 installed.

36
00:01:46.410 --> 00:01:49.915
And first thing we're gonna do is
see how we can launch Excel, and

37
00:01:49.915 --> 00:01:51.839
a few different ways we can do that.

38
00:01:51.839 --> 00:01:55.072
I'm running Windows 10 as my operating
system, and when I look here,

39
00:01:55.072 --> 00:01:56.297
I'm old school, Ronnie.

40
00:01:56.297 --> 00:01:59.838
I like desktop icons, but
I've got nothing out here.

41
00:01:59.838 --> 00:02:01.649
>> [LAUGH]
>> I like task bar icons,

42
00:02:01.649 --> 00:02:04.632
I don't have anything for
Excel down there.

43
00:02:04.632 --> 00:02:11.074
And with Windows 10, we've got this new
fancy Start menu going on over here.

44
00:02:11.074 --> 00:02:12.838
And I don't see Excel there either.

45
00:02:12.838 --> 00:02:14.643
So it almost doesn't look like, or

46
00:02:14.643 --> 00:02:18.080
it almost looks like I don't
have Excel installed at all.

47
00:02:18.080 --> 00:02:18.740
But I do.

48
00:02:18.740 --> 00:02:19.609
So, let's go find it.

49
00:02:19.609 --> 00:02:24.960
So, we're going to go to our Start menu,
and we're going to click on All Apps.

50
00:02:24.960 --> 00:02:28.137
And then, we're going to
scroll through and find Excel.

51
00:02:28.137 --> 00:02:30.481
And this would work, again, for
any of your Office applications.

52
00:02:30.481 --> 00:02:33.420
None of them showed up
when I installed Office.

53
00:02:33.420 --> 00:02:35.554
So, we wanna make them easily accessible.

54
00:02:35.554 --> 00:02:39.729
Easiest way to do that, I think, is just
to either pin it to your Start menu,

55
00:02:39.729 --> 00:02:43.610
pin it to your taskbar or
create a shortcut on your desktop.

56
00:02:43.610 --> 00:02:44.240
So, let's do that.

57
00:02:44.240 --> 00:02:47.067
I'm gonna right-click on that,
and you'll see my options here.

58
00:02:47.067 --> 00:02:48.332
Pin to Start.

59
00:02:48.332 --> 00:02:54.980
If I choose that, well, now I have a new
tile on my Start screen, Start menu.

60
00:02:54.980 --> 00:02:58.382
And now I can move that around,
I can put it wherever I want so

61
00:02:58.382 --> 00:03:00.300
it's easily accessible.

62
00:03:00.300 --> 00:03:05.230
So now, anytime I wanna launch Excel,
I go to my Start menu, and there it is.

63
00:03:05.230 --> 00:03:08.603
The other way we can do it would
be to pin it to our taskbar.

64
00:03:08.603 --> 00:03:11.355
Now, I'm gonna go back to All Apps.

65
00:03:11.355 --> 00:03:16.450
I'm gonna right-click on Excel again,
and choose Pin to Taskbar.

66
00:03:16.450 --> 00:03:19.736
And now I've got that familiar
icon right there on my taskbar,

67
00:03:19.736 --> 00:03:23.964
one of my favorite ways to launch the
application because that's always there.

68
00:03:23.964 --> 00:03:27.931
Even if I have another window
maximized taking up my desktop,

69
00:03:27.931 --> 00:03:30.384
it's right there within easy reach.

70
00:03:30.384 --> 00:03:35.062
And I can right-click on that and
I'll get this, what we call jump list,

71
00:03:35.062 --> 00:03:40.440
where I can see all my recently opened
files, and I love that feature.

72
00:03:40.440 --> 00:03:41.531
All right.

73
00:03:41.531 --> 00:03:44.086
Another way we could do it would be
to put a shortcut on the desktop.

74
00:03:44.086 --> 00:03:46.340
A lot of people love those shortcuts.

75
00:03:46.340 --> 00:03:50.350
I've seen people, Ronnie,
that have dozens and more shortcuts,

76
00:03:50.350 --> 00:03:53.380
where there's no more room on the desktop,
they've got so many shortcuts.

77
00:03:53.380 --> 00:03:56.736
If you're one of those, they don't
make it as easy as they used to.

78
00:03:56.736 --> 00:03:59.280
It's still not difficult,
you just have to know the trick.

79
00:03:59.280 --> 00:04:03.570
I'm gonna go to my, again,
All Applications of my Start menu.

80
00:04:03.570 --> 00:04:05.630
Find Excel, right-click on it.

81
00:04:05.630 --> 00:04:09.186
But there is no create shortcut or
send to desktop option here.

82
00:04:09.186 --> 00:04:11.589
But what I can do is open file location.

83
00:04:12.760 --> 00:04:15.040
That's gonna open up File Explorer and

84
00:04:15.040 --> 00:04:19.290
there's a shortcut to
the program Excel 2016.

85
00:04:19.290 --> 00:04:25.582
I can right-click on that, and
choose Send to Desktop, create shortcut.

86
00:04:25.582 --> 00:04:28.000
Now, when I close File Explorer,

87
00:04:28.000 --> 00:04:30.790
there's my handy dandy little
shortcut right there at my desktop.

88
00:04:30.790 --> 00:04:35.060
So, now that I've got the program
installed, and we've got our icons out

89
00:04:35.060 --> 00:04:38.540
here, we can get to the program anytime we
want, whatever your favorite method is.

90
00:04:38.540 --> 00:04:41.510
If you preferred the taskbar,
hit it down there.

91
00:04:41.510 --> 00:04:44.787
If you want an icon on your desktop,
go open the file location and

92
00:04:44.787 --> 00:04:46.008
send it to the desktop.

93
00:04:46.008 --> 00:04:48.249
And now,
you've got an icon on your desktop.

94
00:04:48.249 --> 00:04:51.830
If you like that new fancy Start menu
with the tiles, well, there it is,

95
00:04:51.830 --> 00:04:52.930
pin it to that.

96
00:04:52.930 --> 00:04:54.210
Or, as I did, pin it to all three.

97
00:04:54.210 --> 00:04:56.394
You can see you don't have
to choose one or the other.

98
00:04:56.394 --> 00:05:00.430
You can do all three, and that way
anywhere you go it's easy to find Excel.

99
00:05:00.430 --> 00:05:04.771
And, of course, we shouldn't forget
we can also type in here Excel, and

100
00:05:04.771 --> 00:05:06.534
it will find it, hopefully.

101
00:05:06.534 --> 00:05:09.146
You know how Cortana is sometimes,
no, just teasing.

102
00:05:09.146 --> 00:05:11.355
Cortana will go find it for you and
she'll put it up there, and

103
00:05:11.355 --> 00:05:12.384
you can click on it that way.

104
00:05:12.384 --> 00:05:18.000
So, several different ways we can set it
up to get in to our favorite application.

105
00:05:18.000 --> 00:05:20.910
>> You know, a lot of times it's
hard to actually realize this.

106
00:05:20.910 --> 00:05:23.080
If you grew up in the days in which,
you know,

107
00:05:23.080 --> 00:05:27.215
all of the applications showed up in that
single Start menu, you're used to do that.

108
00:05:27.215 --> 00:05:30.935
But with the newer, you know,
operating systems like Windows 10,

109
00:05:30.935 --> 00:05:32.520
nothing shows up right away.

110
00:05:32.520 --> 00:05:34.630
And a lot of it's actually
hidden inside of there,

111
00:05:34.630 --> 00:05:36.920
because they expect you
should be working with it.

112
00:05:36.920 --> 00:05:39.932
But if you're like most of us, and
we grew up with another operating system.

113
00:05:39.932 --> 00:05:42.700
We want things to appear fairly familiar.

114
00:05:42.700 --> 00:05:46.396
And putting things on your desktop is one
of the most familiar ways that we can

115
00:05:46.396 --> 00:05:49.127
launch an application without
having to search for it.

116
00:05:49.127 --> 00:05:50.925
And that's the whole goal
behind these applications.

117
00:05:50.925 --> 00:05:54.409
Not so that you go, oh, I don't know if
I'm gonna decide between my taskbar and

118
00:05:54.409 --> 00:05:54.990
my desktop.

119
00:05:54.990 --> 00:05:58.228
But it's to make it easier, so
that you can launch into that application.

120
00:05:58.228 --> 00:06:00.376
And then, once you get into
the application of course,

121
00:06:00.376 --> 00:06:03.452
is now you can do the things that Mike
was talking about, which is exploration.

122
00:06:03.452 --> 00:06:04.032
>> Absolutely.

123
00:06:04.032 --> 00:06:07.491
And it's a great point
whatever works best for you.

124
00:06:07.491 --> 00:06:09.849
I have very few applications down here.

125
00:06:09.849 --> 00:06:14.364
But what if I had 15, 20 different
applications that I wanted easy access to?

126
00:06:14.364 --> 00:06:17.405
Well, I'll start running
out of room on my taskbar.

127
00:06:17.405 --> 00:06:20.238
With this fancy Start menu,
I can create groups,

128
00:06:20.238 --> 00:06:22.270
I can put all these tiles out there.

129
00:06:22.270 --> 00:06:24.488
So, then again, whatever works for you.

130
00:06:24.488 --> 00:06:29.135
>> Now, Mike, I know that in previous
editions of Excel, I could also take

131
00:06:29.135 --> 00:06:34.100
an Excel workbook and actually directly
click on it, and that would open up.

132
00:06:34.100 --> 00:06:35.447
And I'm assuming that still works?

133
00:06:35.447 --> 00:06:36.210
>> Absolutely.

134
00:06:36.210 --> 00:06:38.722
If you already have a spreadsheet, or

135
00:06:38.722 --> 00:06:43.589
somebody emailed one to you as an
attachment, or you copied one down off of

136
00:06:43.589 --> 00:06:48.161
a file server, you can simply find
that file, double-click on it.

137
00:06:48.161 --> 00:06:51.650
And it's gonna open up cuz I've
got a file type association.

138
00:06:51.650 --> 00:06:55.846
It sees that you're clicking on
a spreadsheet, you've got Excel installed,

139
00:06:55.846 --> 00:06:57.422
which is open spreadsheets.

140
00:06:57.422 --> 00:06:59.500
So, it'll go in there and
it'll use Excel to open that up.

141
00:06:59.500 --> 00:07:01.914
So either way you go, it'll work.

142
00:07:01.914 --> 00:07:04.457
And that's definitely a good
way to do it as well.

143
00:07:04.457 --> 00:07:06.806
Especially as I said,
if you've got an attachment,

144
00:07:06.806 --> 00:07:08.276
you copy it over to your desktop.

145
00:07:08.276 --> 00:07:12.303
You don't have to launch the application
and then go file, open and browse and

146
00:07:12.303 --> 00:07:14.378
find it, just double-click on it, and

147
00:07:14.378 --> 00:07:17.018
Windows will take care of
opening it up with Excel.

148
00:07:17.018 --> 00:07:17.737
All right.

149
00:07:17.737 --> 00:07:20.766
So now, that we've got it installed and
we've got it set up so

150
00:07:20.766 --> 00:07:23.518
we can launch it easy,
let's go ahead and launch it up.

151
00:07:23.518 --> 00:07:25.828
I'm gonna use my taskbar icon down there.

152
00:07:25.828 --> 00:07:28.836
And I click that, and
it's going to launch Excel.

153
00:07:28.836 --> 00:07:33.757
When you first launch in to Excel,
by default, you get this start screen.

154
00:07:33.757 --> 00:07:38.302
And the start screen is fantastic because
excel saying, I don't really know what you

155
00:07:38.302 --> 00:07:41.663
wanna do, I know that you wanted
to launch Excel, so here I am.

156
00:07:41.663 --> 00:07:42.640
But I don't know what you wanna do.

157
00:07:42.640 --> 00:07:46.923
Do you wanna work with an existing
document, one you've worked with recently?

158
00:07:46.923 --> 00:07:50.174
Do you want to create
a brand new document?

159
00:07:50.174 --> 00:07:51.679
Would you like to use
one of these templates?

160
00:07:51.679 --> 00:07:54.267
And we're gonna talk about all of
these options as we go through here.

161
00:07:54.267 --> 00:07:56.125
But that's what this start screen is for.

162
00:07:56.125 --> 00:07:57.587
Is it saying.

163
00:07:57.587 --> 00:07:58.319
What would like to do?

164
00:07:58.319 --> 00:08:01.883
And you can see over here on the left,

165
00:08:01.883 --> 00:08:06.080
So this is showing me documents
that I've worked with recently.

166
00:08:06.080 --> 00:08:10.320
Now, this list will change as you

167
00:08:10.320 --> 00:08:14.800
the ones who haven't opened up in a while,
will slowly get bumped off this list,

168
00:08:14.800 --> 00:08:18.110

00:08:18.110 --> 00:08:21.590
If you have one that you

170
00:08:21.590 --> 00:08:24.700
you want it to be on this list

00:08:24.700 --> 00:08:28.190
You see when I hover over this

172
00:08:28.190 --> 00:08:32.650
If I click on that, now that one

173
00:08:32.650 --> 00:08:35.560
So it will always be there,
even if I don't open it up for

174
00:08:35.560 --> 00:08:39.060
a month,
it'll still be at the top of the list.

175
00:08:39.060 --> 00:08:42.260
Another great thing that I love to do,
cuz I've got a couple workbooks that

176
00:08:42.260 --> 00:08:46.370
I always want quick access to but
I don't open them up everyday.

177
00:08:46.370 --> 00:08:51.030
So I pin them to my list here and
I can get quick easy access to them.

178
00:08:51.030 --> 00:08:54.530
You can do the same thing on
your jump list down here.

179
00:08:54.530 --> 00:08:58.170
When I right click on the icon
I get this jump list.

180
00:08:58.170 --> 00:08:58.820
It's the same thing.

181
00:08:58.820 --> 00:09:01.970
It's showing me these
recently opened spreadsheets.

182
00:09:01.970 --> 00:09:06.160
If I have one that I want to pin,
I can simply click on the pushpin and

183
00:09:06.160 --> 00:09:09.740
now that one will always remain
at the top of this list.

184
00:09:09.740 --> 00:09:11.880
These lists are independent.

185
00:09:11.880 --> 00:09:14.250
Right, I pinned employees over here.

186
00:09:14.250 --> 00:09:16.590
I don't have to pin employees on this one.

187
00:09:16.590 --> 00:09:19.130
So they are two different lists there.

188
00:09:20.430 --> 00:09:24.160
The other thing you can do is you
can browse and open other workbooks.

189
00:09:24.160 --> 00:09:28.065
So you can click on Open Other workbooks,
and that's gonna take you to an area where

190
00:09:28.065 --> 00:09:32.925
you can go and open a file,
I can click Browse, and I can navigate.

191
00:09:32.925 --> 00:09:36.685
Maybe I've got a folder where I've
downloaded a bunch of spreadsheets,

192
00:09:36.685 --> 00:09:41.435
I can simply navigate my way in,
find those spreadsheets, and

00:09:41.435 --> 00:09:45.080
I can select it and

194
00:09:45.080 --> 00:09:46.400
Let me close that real quick.

195
00:09:46.400 --> 00:09:47.816
We'll go back out to

00:09:50.107 --> 00:09:53.610
In fact, let me just relaunch so we can
take a look at that Start screen just

197
00:09:53.610 --> 00:09:55.940
a little bit more before we get into it.

198
00:09:55.940 --> 00:09:57.490
So we've got our recent list.

199
00:09:57.490 --> 00:10:00.930
We've got our browse capabilities
to browse to other locations and

200
00:10:00.930 --> 00:10:03.490
find a document that we wanna open.

201
00:10:03.490 --> 00:10:06.140
Over here on the right,
we've got these icons.

202
00:10:06.140 --> 00:10:09.770
And the first one says, Blank Workbook.

203
00:10:09.770 --> 00:10:13.180
This would create,
you guessed it, a blank workbook.

204
00:10:13.180 --> 00:10:14.150
So if you're just trying to.

205
00:10:14.150 --> 00:10:16.330
If you're starting from scratch and
you wanna create a new workbook,

206
00:10:16.330 --> 00:10:17.540
you would simply click on it.

207
00:10:18.570 --> 00:10:21.060
And it's gonna open up
a brand new workbook.

208
00:10:21.060 --> 00:10:25.510
And then I can start working, and
start creating my new document.

209
00:10:25.510 --> 00:10:31.260
Now the other ones, and I'll go back
out one more time, we're going to

210
00:10:31.260 --> 00:10:35.630
talk about these in a later episode, these
are templates, and they're really neat.

211
00:10:35.630 --> 00:10:36.920
They give me a starting point.

212
00:10:36.920 --> 00:10:39.030
Instead of starting with a blank workbook,

213
00:10:39.030 --> 00:10:42.500
I can actually start with
a pre-built template.

214
00:10:42.500 --> 00:10:45.040
Give me a head start on whatever
project I'm working on.

215
00:10:45.040 --> 00:10:47.750
I'll show you how to use those
in a little bit in the future.

216
00:10:47.750 --> 00:10:50.852
So for now, let's just stick
with a good old blank workbook,

217
00:10:50.852 --> 00:10:54.372
because the next thing I wanna show
us Ron, is the interface itself and

218
00:10:54.372 --> 00:10:56.600
how we can go about
navigating around here.

219
00:10:56.600 --> 00:10:59.620
>> You know Mike, I actually
take a look at the other top and

220
00:10:59.620 --> 00:11:03.195
I see that just on that first
screen that you open up.

221
00:11:03.195 --> 00:11:06.350
There looks like a ton of
different tools up there and

222
00:11:06.350 --> 00:11:09.620
I think if I was first time using it,
I would get a bit intimidated.

223
00:11:09.620 --> 00:11:12.740
>> Absolutely, it can be a little
frightening when you first see this.

224
00:11:12.740 --> 00:11:15.980
But, never fear,
we're going to make sense of all of it.

225
00:11:15.980 --> 00:11:20.730
One of the things that Microsoft did,
and I believe this started in 2007,

226
00:11:20.730 --> 00:11:24.100
they went to what we call a ribbon format.

227
00:11:24.100 --> 00:11:25.720
Before that we had those menus.

228
00:11:25.720 --> 00:11:28.170
So if you've been using
applications in the past,

229
00:11:28.170 --> 00:11:32.860
you might remember we had to click on
File, and a drop down list would appear.

230
00:11:32.860 --> 00:11:34.510
And the problem with that was one,

231
00:11:34.510 --> 00:11:37.330
it would end up covering up
part of your document, so

232
00:11:37.330 --> 00:11:41.400
as you drop the different menus down
it would hide some of your document,

233
00:11:41.400 --> 00:11:46.850
which is always a kind of a pain when you
would wanna select a font, for example.

234
00:11:46.850 --> 00:11:51.180
And it would hide the font itself,
so they went to these ribbons, and

235
00:11:51.180 --> 00:11:56.030
it allows them to make everything
available easily right at my finger tips.

236
00:11:56.030 --> 00:11:57.310
As we go through here,

237
00:11:57.310 --> 00:12:02.510
we'll see there's actually see several
Ribbons across the top of this workbook.

238
00:12:02.510 --> 00:12:07.790
I got my Home Ribbon and
here I've got a lot of my common tools.

239
00:12:07.790 --> 00:12:11.010
Things like Cut Copy and
Paste are going to be out here.

240
00:12:11.010 --> 00:12:16.960
The ability to change my Font and my Font
size and my Font color, my Alignment.

241
00:12:16.960 --> 00:12:19.400
And you'll notice,
they're organized, right?

242
00:12:19.400 --> 00:12:23.040
There's little dividing lines between
there and I can see the word alignment

243
00:12:23.040 --> 00:12:27.710
right here, so between these two lines,
this is known as a ribbon group and this

244
00:12:27.710 --> 00:12:33.200
is where all of the alignment tools reside
and there's another group for numbers.

245
00:12:33.200 --> 00:12:34.430
For like formatting.

246
00:12:34.430 --> 00:12:36.450
There's another group for styles.

247
00:12:36.450 --> 00:12:37.980
Another one for cells.

248
00:12:37.980 --> 00:12:42.370
So they're trying to organize these tools,
make them a little bit easier to find.

249
00:12:42.370 --> 00:12:44.530
And then we've got several
different ribbons.

250
00:12:44.530 --> 00:12:46.350
We've got the insert ribbon,

251
00:12:46.350 --> 00:12:49.330
which is where all my tools that
I would use to insert things.

252
00:12:49.330 --> 00:12:52.840
Like inserting pivot tables,
or inserting illustrations, or

253
00:12:52.840 --> 00:12:56.250
inserting Charts or filters, okay?

254
00:12:56.250 --> 00:13:00.590
If I move on, I've got my Page Layout
ribbon and as you would expect, this is

255
00:13:00.590 --> 00:13:03.870
where I can find things that are gonna
affect the layout of the page itself.

256
00:13:03.870 --> 00:13:08.780
Margins, Orientation,
Landscape versus Portrait and

257
00:13:08.780 --> 00:13:14.350
my Print Area,
my Gridlines are gonna be on there.

258
00:13:14.350 --> 00:13:15.350
Keep moving down the row.

259
00:13:15.350 --> 00:13:20.550
I've got a Formulas ribbon, where I can
find all of my functions and formulas.

260
00:13:20.550 --> 00:13:23.700
I've got my data ribbon
where I can work with data.

261
00:13:23.700 --> 00:13:25.220
I can import data.

262
00:13:25.220 --> 00:13:27.700
I can go out and
get it from an external source.

263
00:13:27.700 --> 00:13:30.070
I can set up data connections.

264
00:13:30.070 --> 00:13:32.410
We can sort and filter the data.

265
00:13:32.410 --> 00:13:36.130
I've got a data tools,
I've got forecast tools.

266
00:13:36.130 --> 00:13:40.270
So all the things that I would use to
work with the actual data reside here.

267
00:13:40.270 --> 00:13:44.810
I've got a review ribbon and this is
where I would find all my review tools.

268
00:13:44.810 --> 00:13:49.050
My thesaurus,
my spell checker, my comments,

269
00:13:49.050 --> 00:13:52.530
my translation,
all of that's gonna be here.

270
00:13:52.530 --> 00:13:58.140
And then that last ribbon they have is
a View Menu, where as you might expect,

271
00:13:58.140 --> 00:14:01.300
I find tools to change the way
I'm looking at things.

272
00:14:01.300 --> 00:14:04.660
Where I can zoom in or
out of this document.

273
00:14:04.660 --> 00:14:08.830
I can change between a normal
view verses a print preview.

274
00:14:08.830 --> 00:14:13.900
I can split the panes or
hide certain areas or combine windows.

275
00:14:13.900 --> 00:14:17.040
We can do all kinds of things, again,
things that have to do with the view.

276
00:14:17.040 --> 00:14:18.990
So you start to see how
these tools are organized.

277
00:14:18.990 --> 00:14:21.270
So there are a lot of tools, right.

278
00:14:21.270 --> 00:14:24.690
As Ronnie said, it can be a little bit
intimidating, though you start to realize

279
00:14:24.690 --> 00:14:28.210
that they've tried to organize them
to make them easier to work with.

280
00:14:28.210 --> 00:14:32.580
So they're all out there, we just have
to remember what ribbon they're on.

281
00:14:33.890 --> 00:14:35.020
It really does, I think,

282
00:14:35.020 --> 00:14:39.000
in the end make it a lot easier to
work with once you get used to it.

283
00:14:39.000 --> 00:14:42.150
If you're used to the old menu
driven systems, as Ronnie said,

284
00:14:42.150 --> 00:14:43.810
it might be a little bit intimidating.

285
00:14:43.810 --> 00:14:46.890
Once you get used to it,
you'll find you really really like, or

286
00:14:46.890 --> 00:14:49.840
I think you'll really
really like these ribbons.

287
00:14:49.840 --> 00:14:54.280
Another cool thing about all the tools
being out here like this is that we can

288
00:14:54.280 --> 00:14:55.670
one see them, right?

289
00:14:55.670 --> 00:15:00.060
Cuz they're tools in Excel 2003
that you probably never even saw.

290
00:15:00.060 --> 00:15:02.800
They were there, but
you never dove down into that menu,

291
00:15:02.800 --> 00:15:04.490
didn't even realize they were there.

292
00:15:04.490 --> 00:15:07.290
Here you get to see just about everything.

293
00:15:07.290 --> 00:15:10.520
And if you don't know what something is,
you can just hover over it.

294
00:15:10.520 --> 00:15:13.660
And you're gonna get a little tool tip,
like if you didn't know what that

295
00:15:13.660 --> 00:15:16.520
button did, all I'm doing is putting
my cursor, I'm not clicking.

296
00:15:16.520 --> 00:15:20.690
I'm just moving my cursor over that icon
and it's telling me oh, that's center.

297
00:15:20.690 --> 00:15:25.030
And if I click that it's
gonna center my content.

298
00:15:25.030 --> 00:15:26.510
This one over here, what does that do?

299
00:15:27.700 --> 00:15:28.740
Oh it's a percent style,

300
00:15:28.740 --> 00:15:32.970
it'll format whatever I have
selected as a percent, right?

301
00:15:32.970 --> 00:15:37.210
So take your time and explore,
hover over all these different buttons,

302
00:15:37.210 --> 00:15:38.960
see what the heck they do.

303
00:15:38.960 --> 00:15:44.400
And that way you'll start to become
a little more comfortable with those.

304
00:15:44.400 --> 00:15:47.434
Now as I said not all of
the tools are out here.

305
00:15:47.434 --> 00:15:50.952
They do try to fit as many as they can out
there but two things are gonna happen.

306
00:15:50.952 --> 00:15:53.482
One Your resolution can mess you up.

307
00:15:53.482 --> 00:15:57.871
Let me minimize this for, or
not minimize but I'm gonna restore down.

308
00:15:57.871 --> 00:16:02.602
If you'd notice like these cells,
I've got this big old button for

309
00:16:02.602 --> 00:16:05.690
Insert, Delete, and Format.

310
00:16:05.690 --> 00:16:07.938
Well I'm gonna make my window
a little bit smaller, and

311
00:16:07.938 --> 00:16:12.710
notice now I have these little tiny
buttons for Insert, Delete, and Format.

312
00:16:12.710 --> 00:16:16.968
And heck if I can press it even more,
I don't know if it'll much more.

313
00:16:16.968 --> 00:16:21.830
You'll start seeing some of these other
buttons start disappearing, right?

314
00:16:21.830 --> 00:16:23.770
Because there's just no more room for it.

315
00:16:23.770 --> 00:16:26.870
I maximize it, and they come back out.

316
00:16:26.870 --> 00:16:30.740
So, you might be at one machine, and
you've got these nice big buttons, and

317
00:16:30.740 --> 00:16:32.990
then you go home or
on a different computer at work.

318
00:16:32.990 --> 00:16:33.827
And all of a sudden,

319
00:16:33.827 --> 00:16:37.540
those buttons don't look the same, or
they're not in quite the same place.

320
00:16:37.540 --> 00:16:38.170
Well, don't panic.

321
00:16:38.170 --> 00:16:41.470
It's probably just because either
the window's not maximized or

322
00:16:41.470 --> 00:16:42.530
the resolution is different.

323
00:16:42.530 --> 00:16:46.490
If it's a smaller screen,
they can't fit all those buttons on there.

324
00:16:46.490 --> 00:16:52.180
They'll make them a little bit smaller so
they can fit them the best they can.

325
00:16:52.180 --> 00:16:56.180
Now even then, they can't show me
all the tools on these ribbons.

326
00:16:56.180 --> 00:16:59.970
Some of these groups you'll
notice have a little button

327
00:16:59.970 --> 00:17:02.050
down in the bottom right hand corner.

328
00:17:02.050 --> 00:17:04.590
Those are my dialog box launchers.

329
00:17:04.590 --> 00:17:09.530
So for like my font,
I can see I can choose my font, my size.

330
00:17:09.530 --> 00:17:12.170
I can do an increase and
decrease on my font.

331
00:17:12.170 --> 00:17:13.850
I can do my bold, italics, underline.

332
00:17:13.850 --> 00:17:17.300
I've got some border options,
color options.

333
00:17:17.300 --> 00:17:18.060
That's not everything.

334
00:17:18.060 --> 00:17:22.070
If I click this little button down here,
this dialog box launcher,

335
00:17:23.190 --> 00:17:25.980
it opens up a whole another dialog box.

336
00:17:25.980 --> 00:17:29.200
And now I can see things like
Strikethrough and Superscript and

337
00:17:29.200 --> 00:17:30.570
Subscript.

338
00:17:30.570 --> 00:17:33.480
Those weren't out there because
there wasn't enough room.

339
00:17:33.480 --> 00:17:36.450
Or maybe they felt like we
don't use those often enough

340
00:17:36.450 --> 00:17:38.690
to put them out there on the ribbon.

341
00:17:38.690 --> 00:17:41.702
So it's another thing to keep in
mind as you're going through here.

342
00:17:41.702 --> 00:17:44.062
If you don't see the tool
you're looking for,

343
00:17:44.062 --> 00:17:47.427
look to see if there's a little
dialog box launcher in that group and

344
00:17:47.427 --> 00:17:51.400
you'll probably get some more options,
more than what show up on your ribbon.

345
00:17:51.400 --> 00:17:55.820
Now another thing that we have to
worry about with this ribbons is,

346
00:17:55.820 --> 00:17:57.180
not all of them are there.

347
00:17:57.180 --> 00:18:00.430
Some of the ribbons are what
we call contextual ribbons and

348
00:18:00.430 --> 00:18:03.380
you only see them when you need them.

349
00:18:03.380 --> 00:18:06.618
For example, let me open up a file here.

350
00:18:06.618 --> 00:18:10.494
I'm gonna do a little File > Open and
then I'll navigate over to My Documents.

351
00:18:14.410 --> 00:18:17.240
And there we go, it looked like
a blank workbook for a second.

352
00:18:17.240 --> 00:18:18.900
I almost panicked.

353
00:18:18.900 --> 00:18:23.321
So here's one, and I can see my standard
ribbons, Home, Insert, Page Layout,

354
00:18:23.321 --> 00:18:25.452
Formulas, Data, Review, and View.

355
00:18:25.452 --> 00:18:27.650
But watch what happens when
I click on this table.

356
00:18:29.360 --> 00:18:32.380
I get a whole another menu, or
whole other ribbon, I should say.

357
00:18:32.380 --> 00:18:35.350
It's my TableTools design ribbon.

358
00:18:35.350 --> 00:18:39.410
Because I have a table selected,
it says, hey, how about I show you

359
00:18:39.410 --> 00:18:43.950
some cool things you can do with tables,
like changing the style of the table.

360
00:18:43.950 --> 00:18:48.830
Or changing, you can see it kind of
changes as I hover over these guys.

361
00:18:48.830 --> 00:18:51.250
Or changing the header rows or

362
00:18:51.250 --> 00:18:54.620
the filter buttons,
things that you would do with a table.

363
00:18:54.620 --> 00:18:57.970
If I click away from that
table that ribbon goes away.

364
00:18:57.970 --> 00:19:00.670
Excel says well,
you don't have a table selected,

365
00:19:00.670 --> 00:19:04.680
why bother taking up space
showing you those table tools?

366
00:19:04.680 --> 00:19:08.760
Same thing with a chart, if I click
on this chart I get two more ribbons.

367
00:19:08.760 --> 00:19:13.840
I get my Chart Design ribbon where I
can change the style of that chart.

368
00:19:13.840 --> 00:19:18.430
I've also got my Chart Format ribbon,
where I can change things like my shape

369
00:19:18.430 --> 00:19:23.640
styles, and my word art, and
format the text that's on that chat.

370
00:19:23.640 --> 00:19:27.450
Click away, and those two ribbons go away.

371
00:19:27.450 --> 00:19:30.860
So those are known as contextual ribbons,
and I wanna bring them up, one,

372
00:19:30.860 --> 00:19:32.700
because we need to know they're there.

373
00:19:32.700 --> 00:19:36.840
And two, I've seen people panic, they'll
have a table on their spreadsheet, but

374
00:19:36.840 --> 00:19:40.630
their cursor's over here somewhere.

375
00:19:40.630 --> 00:19:44.240
Well as soon as you click away from that
table those ribbons are gonna go away.

376
00:19:44.240 --> 00:19:48.880
Never fear, click back on the table and
that ribbon will show right back up.

377
00:19:48.880 --> 00:19:51.350
So those are known as contextual ribbons.

378
00:19:51.350 --> 00:19:54.070
Another thing we can do with
these ribbons is we can hide them

379
00:19:54.070 --> 00:19:56.630
on a smaller screen like I've got here.

380
00:19:56.630 --> 00:19:59.220
These ribbons take up a lot
of valuable real estate.

381
00:19:59.220 --> 00:20:03.550
That's less rows that I can look at

00:31:54.910 --> 00:31:57.280
And once you start actually
being comfortable with that,

612
00:31:57.280 --> 00:32:01.080
then creating workbooks, again, modifying
them is not going to be so difficult.

613
00:32:01.080 --> 00:32:03.050
So again, thank you, Mike, for helping us.

614
00:32:03.050 --> 00:32:04.400
With that as well.

615
00:32:04.400 --> 00:32:07.890
And you still want to stay tuned for
more here for Excel 2016.

616
00:32:07.890 --> 00:32:10.800
We got plenty more episodes coming up.

617
00:32:10.800 --> 00:32:15.080
Signing off for IT PRO TV I'm Ronnie Wong
>> And I'm Mike Roderick and

618
00:32:15.080 --> 00:32:21.959
we'll see you next time [SOUND]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike start to show us how to create a basic workbook using various methods in Excel.  These methods will help us to get up and working quickly, as the guys demonstrate.  They show how to create a blank workbook, how to create workbook from pre-made templates and even by importing data directly into an Excel workbook.  All of these methods really do lend to someone starting with excel to realize the power of excel to improve your productivity.
episodes.title: Creating Workbooks
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.796 --> 00:00:15.531
Welcome to another exciting
episode right here on ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.531 --> 00:00:17.710
I'm your host Ronnie Wong and

4
00:00:17.710 --> 00:00:21.570
today we're gonna be taking a look
at working with Excel 2016.

5
00:00:21.570 --> 00:00:25.260
Now we're specifically gonna be
dealing with workbooks and worksheets.

6
00:00:25.260 --> 00:00:27.740
And so who better to help us than Mr.
Mike Rodrick.

7
00:00:27.740 --> 00:00:29.701
Now Mike, when it comes down to it,
let's go ahead and

8
00:00:29.701 --> 00:00:32.390
answer the lifelong question here
that everybody wants to know.

9
00:00:32.390 --> 00:00:34.817
What is the different
between a workbook and

10
00:00:34.817 --> 00:00:37.588
a worksheet as we get
started into 2016 here?

11
00:00:37.588 --> 00:00:39.676
>> [LAUGH] That's a great question Ronnie,
and

12
00:00:39.676 --> 00:00:42.670
it is something we really
need to understand, right?

13
00:00:42.670 --> 00:00:44.300
When we talk about worksheets and
workbooks,

14
00:00:44.300 --> 00:00:46.790
some people might use those
terms interchangeably.

15
00:00:46.790 --> 00:00:51.370
But the truth of it is
the workbook is the container.

16
00:00:51.370 --> 00:00:54.610
The workbook contains worksheets.

17
00:00:54.610 --> 00:00:58.835
So when you create a new, some people say,
I'm gonna go create a new spreadsheet.

18
00:00:58.835 --> 00:01:02.750
Well, really, when you open up Excel,
you're creating a new workbook.

19
00:01:02.750 --> 00:01:06.440
And then, within that book,
you're gonna contain worksheets.

20
00:01:06.440 --> 00:01:12.540
And a workbook can contain a single
sheet or it can contain several sheets.

21
00:01:12.540 --> 00:01:14.000
Let's take a look and
I'll show you what I mean here.

22
00:01:14.000 --> 00:01:18.070
All right, so when I launch Excel, we're
gonna come to that good old start screen,

23
00:01:18.070 --> 00:01:20.810
and notice I've got the option for
blank workbook.

24
00:01:20.810 --> 00:01:23.360
Not worksheet, right, workbook.

25
00:01:23.360 --> 00:01:26.860
And when we create that workbook,
there we go, we've got a new workbook,

26
00:01:26.860 --> 00:01:29.850
within that workbook I have one worksheet.

27
00:01:29.850 --> 00:01:32.480
So again,
the workbook is the outer container.

28
00:01:32.480 --> 00:01:36.546
The worksheets are the tabs,
if you will, within that workbook.

29
00:01:36.546 --> 00:01:41.920
And again I could have one or I could have
several worksheets within this workbook.

30
00:01:41.920 --> 00:01:45.163
Another thing I wanna point out that's
a little bit different if you haven't used

31
00:01:45.163 --> 00:01:45.921
Office in a while.

32
00:01:45.921 --> 00:01:50.930
In the past, we could work with more
than one workbook in a single window.

33
00:01:50.930 --> 00:01:57.290
Well, now with Excel if I do File ->
New and create another workbook, you'll

34
00:01:57.290 --> 00:02:02.490
see I have up here Book2, but if I restore
down you'll see I have a second window.

35
00:02:02.490 --> 00:02:05.284
So, unlike some of the older
versions of Office,

36
00:02:05.284 --> 00:02:10.086
each workbook is now gonna be found in its
own window when you're working with Excel.

37
00:02:10.086 --> 00:02:11.260
All right?

38
00:02:11.260 --> 00:02:13.480
So, a blank workbook is
a good place to start,

39
00:02:13.480 --> 00:02:15.350
if you have an idea of what you wanna do.

40
00:02:15.350 --> 00:02:18.160
If you wanna start importing some data or

41
00:02:18.160 --> 00:02:23.280
you wanna start entering some data,
maybe a blank workbook is what you need.

42
00:02:23.280 --> 00:02:27.610
Other times, though, it'd be nice if
we had some kind of starting point.

43
00:02:27.610 --> 00:02:30.980
And Microsoft gives us
templates to do that.

44
00:02:30.980 --> 00:02:34.530
For example, Ronnie, we're gonna
start this good old pet store and

45
00:02:34.530 --> 00:02:35.760
we need a sales invoice.

46
00:02:35.760 --> 00:02:38.850
I need some way to bill my customers and

47
00:02:38.850 --> 00:02:42.960
my suppliers and things like that or
give them a receipt for an order.

48
00:02:42.960 --> 00:02:44.232
Well, I could start from scratch.

49
00:02:44.232 --> 00:02:48.850
I could design my own sales receipt,
get everything done,

50
00:02:48.850 --> 00:02:51.000
but that might take me a while.

51
00:02:51.000 --> 00:02:53.640
And I want to be able to start
billing people right now.

52
00:02:53.640 --> 00:02:58.140
So what I can do is I can use a template
from Microsoft's online gallery.

53
00:02:58.140 --> 00:02:59.920
I'm gonna back over here to File.

54
00:02:59.920 --> 00:03:05.712
And I'm gonna close that blank workbook,
and then File and New.

55
00:03:05.712 --> 00:03:09.988
And instead of clicking blank workbook,
I'm gonna choose a template.

56
00:03:09.988 --> 00:03:13.350
Now on this start screen,
they give you a few different templates,

57
00:03:13.350 --> 00:03:17.030
some of the more common ones
that we might want to use.

58
00:03:17.030 --> 00:03:21.190
If none of those suits your needs,
there are thousands of templates online.

59
00:03:21.190 --> 00:03:23.430
We just need to find the one we want.

60
00:03:23.430 --> 00:03:27.630
So we'll simply type in our little
search bar here, sales invoice.

61
00:03:29.630 --> 00:03:30.830
Hit enter.

62
00:03:30.830 --> 00:03:32.230
Let it go out there and search.

63
00:03:32.230 --> 00:03:34.880
You can see searching
thousands of online templates.

64
00:03:34.880 --> 00:03:40.570
And what comes back is going to be
a whole bunch of sales invoice templates.

65
00:03:40.570 --> 00:03:45.410
In there, we got, I can see I have
quite a few to scroll through.

66
00:03:46.640 --> 00:03:47.150
All right.

67
00:03:47.150 --> 00:03:48.890
And then you just simply
pick the one you want.

68
00:03:48.890 --> 00:03:52.370
You find one you think might be right,
you click on it, and

69
00:03:52.370 --> 00:03:56.720
you can get a larger view of
that sales invoice template.

70
00:03:56.720 --> 00:03:59.690
And if you decide that that's the one
you want, you can click Create.

71
00:03:59.690 --> 00:04:02.050
Or you can start scrolling
through some of the other ones,

72
00:04:02.050 --> 00:04:03.980
see if you can find a better one.

73
00:04:03.980 --> 00:04:07.270
If this is the one I like,
I'll go ahead and click Create.

74
00:04:07.270 --> 00:04:10.510
And what it's gonna do is it's
gonna create a new workbook

75
00:04:10.510 --> 00:04:12.380
based off of that template.

76
00:04:12.380 --> 00:04:15.330
And look, it's got everything
all filled out already.

77
00:04:15.330 --> 00:04:21.570
It's got my place to put my company name,
it's got my ship to address and

78
00:04:21.570 --> 00:04:25.890
my from address, has my information
to put down my quantity, my items,

79
00:04:25.890 --> 00:04:27.970
it's all formatted nice and pretty.

80
00:04:27.970 --> 00:04:31.390
A place for totals, it even says,
thank you for your business.

81
00:04:31.390 --> 00:04:33.190
And I didn't have to do any of that.

82
00:04:33.190 --> 00:04:36.430
All I have to do now is go in and
modify some of this stuff.

83
00:04:36.430 --> 00:04:40.830
I can come in here and replace that
company name with my information.

84
00:04:40.830 --> 00:04:43.450
We'll say Mike's Pet Store.

85
00:04:46.190 --> 00:04:48.400
Fill out my slogan.

86
00:04:48.400 --> 00:04:50.700
I can't think of a good slogan for
my pet store.

87
00:04:50.700 --> 00:04:54.942
So maybe we just don't use a slogan,
insert your logos, all that good stuff.

88
00:04:54.942 --> 00:04:59.010
And so you can see that the power of the
templates is it gives me a starting point.

89
00:04:59.010 --> 00:05:00.540
I can use it just like it is and

90
00:05:00.540 --> 00:05:04.980
just replace the information with my
information, or maybe I just use this as

91
00:05:04.980 --> 00:05:08.140
a jumping-off point and
maybe I start making some changes to it.

92
00:05:08.140 --> 00:05:10.080
Maybe we don't have customer ID, so

93
00:05:10.080 --> 00:05:12.242
I start getting rid of
some of that information.

94
00:05:12.242 --> 00:05:16.800
Maybe I don't like the color blue,
so I wanna do this in orange or

95
00:05:16.800 --> 00:05:18.040
something like that.

96
00:05:18.040 --> 00:05:23.200
So we can use that template as is or
I can modify it to suit my needs.

97
00:05:23.200 --> 00:05:27.520
And then what we would do, this is
something that I wanna reuse, right?

98
00:05:27.520 --> 00:05:31.940
And I don't wanna have to fill this
information in every time, like,

99
00:05:31.940 --> 00:05:33.260
Mike's Pet Store.

100
00:05:33.260 --> 00:05:36.671
So, what I'm gonna do is I'm gonna
save this but not as a workbook.

101
00:05:36.671 --> 00:05:38.754
I'm actually gonna save it as a template.

102
00:05:38.754 --> 00:05:46.270
So I'm gonna go File, Save, and
then I'm going to click Browse.

103
00:05:46.270 --> 00:05:50.690
And when I go to save it,
I'm gonna change the Save As type

104
00:05:51.950 --> 00:05:56.880
to Excel template and that's gonna
change where it's gonna save the file.

105
00:05:56.880 --> 00:05:58.710
I would recommend you don't change this.

106
00:05:58.710 --> 00:06:02.390
I'd let it put it where it wants,
because when you launch Excel,

107
00:06:02.390 --> 00:06:06.620
it's gonna look here for all the templates
that you've created or modified and

108
00:06:06.620 --> 00:06:08.240
I want it to show up in that list.

109
00:06:08.240 --> 00:06:09.450
I'll show you what I mean.

110
00:06:09.450 --> 00:06:14.990
Let's change this to something like

111
00:06:14.990 --> 00:06:20.680
Mike's Pet Store Sales Invoice.

112
00:06:20.680 --> 00:06:22.950
I'll, again, leave it in that location.

113
00:06:22.950 --> 00:06:23.630
I'll click Save.

114
00:06:25.290 --> 00:06:27.310
Right.
Now, I'll close this file.

115
00:06:30.070 --> 00:06:34.932
And when I go to create a new file,
instead of searching online for templates,

116
00:06:34.932 --> 00:06:36.713
I'm gonna click Personal.

117
00:06:36.713 --> 00:06:39.730
And there's my
Mike's Pet Store Sales Invoice.

118
00:06:39.730 --> 00:06:44.210
I click it and it's already got
my information filled in, right?

119
00:06:44.210 --> 00:06:48.330
So that's the power of these templates,
is you can use them as a starting point,

120
00:06:48.330 --> 00:06:50.050
they can contain information.

121
00:06:50.050 --> 00:06:54.010
The stuff that's gonna be in there every
time, I can save it in this template.

122
00:06:54.010 --> 00:06:57.530
And then every time I need a new sales
invoice, I just make a new one based off

123
00:06:57.530 --> 00:07:01.080
that template, fill in this
particular customer's information and

124
00:07:01.080 --> 00:07:03.680
order information, and we're good to go.

125
00:07:03.680 --> 00:07:05.590
>> Now Mike,
when we talk about using a template,

126
00:07:05.590 --> 00:07:09.100
most of the time when I take a look
at them, like I'm kinda amazed about

127
00:07:09.100 --> 00:07:11.920
how the formatting works and
everything else that's in there.

128
00:07:11.920 --> 00:07:15.161
Remember that there's also formulas that
are also in here that are pre-built that

129
00:07:15.161 --> 00:07:17.360
actually give us the invoice
that we want to.

130
00:07:17.360 --> 00:07:19.840
Now, the advantage of this, if you're
looking at it like, that doesn't look so

131
00:07:19.840 --> 00:07:22.440
amazing, you gotta realize
what's actually happening.

132
00:07:22.440 --> 00:07:25.750
If Mike were to start this from scratch,
right, he'd have to come up with

133
00:07:25.750 --> 00:07:29.310
all the formatting and
then also build all those formulas and

134
00:07:29.310 --> 00:07:31.940
actually format everything
the way that we need to.

135
00:07:31.940 --> 00:07:34.940
And what this means is it
takes Mike a long time and

136
00:07:34.940 --> 00:07:39.050
we're starting from scratch before
Mike can ever even create an invoice.

137
00:07:39.050 --> 00:07:42.668
By using the templates that actually
exist right here right now,

138
00:07:42.668 --> 00:07:44.922
Mike can simply do a few modifications.

139
00:07:44.922 --> 00:07:48.053
But what it give him the advantage to
be able to do if he's starting this pet

140
00:07:48.053 --> 00:07:50.832
store, somebody comes in and
decides they want to buy some pets,

141
00:07:50.832 --> 00:07:54.087
is he immediately can pull this thing up,
fill in the information he needs.

142
00:07:54.087 --> 00:07:58.613
And he's actually working inside of Excel
to create that invoice right away, without

143
00:07:58.613 --> 00:08:02.586
Mike ever having to actually figure
out all those other advanced formulas.

144
00:08:02.586 --> 00:08:04.140
Or even how he wants this to look.

145
00:08:04.140 --> 00:08:07.258
If it will work for him right away,
that's what we wanna do.

146
00:08:07.258 --> 00:08:10.714
And that's the power of that template
is to be able to get him to work

147
00:08:10.714 --> 00:08:14.544
with the data right away as quickly as
possible without having to deal with

148
00:08:14.544 --> 00:08:17.530
all the other extraneous
things that are also here.

149
00:08:17.530 --> 00:08:20.450
So it really is a powerful advantage
to all of us if we need to get

150
00:08:20.450 --> 00:08:21.450
started immediately.

151
00:08:21.450 --> 00:08:23.970
>> Yeah, like I said,
it's a great starting point.

152
00:08:23.970 --> 00:08:26.300
It saves me a whole lot of time.

153
00:08:26.300 --> 00:08:31.320
I'm a pet store owner,
I don't know how to create invoices and

154
00:08:31.320 --> 00:08:36.360
graphical design and what looks pretty and
what colors to use and things like that.

155
00:08:36.360 --> 00:08:37.790
Somebody else has already done that work.

156
00:08:37.790 --> 00:08:42.970
I can go out there grab this template and
just get started selling pets,

157
00:08:42.970 --> 00:08:44.049
doing what I do best.

158
00:08:45.340 --> 00:08:46.890
All right so we've got our templates.

159
00:08:46.890 --> 00:08:50.030
Now the next thing we want to
take a look at is working with

160
00:08:50.030 --> 00:08:53.070
work sheets within our work books.

161
00:08:53.070 --> 00:08:56.900
Like I said when you tart a brand
new workbook it has one sheet in it.

162
00:08:56.900 --> 00:09:00.740
But most of the time we end up
wanting more than one sheet in there.

163
00:09:00.740 --> 00:09:05.540
Let me close this guy and
I'll go ahead and

164
00:09:05.540 --> 00:09:09.430
save that, since it's our nice,
now that's not an actual template.

165
00:09:09.430 --> 00:09:12.260
So I'm gonna put it back
over in my documents.

166
00:09:14.160 --> 00:09:18.330
Now I'll put it in Excel, and
we'll call it invoice one, that's fine for

167
00:09:18.330 --> 00:09:19.292
our first customer.

168
00:09:19.292 --> 00:09:25.000
All right, now, I'm gonna open up
a spreadsheet that I made earlier,

169
00:09:26.590 --> 00:09:29.730
and this is where we've I'm
starting to track our inventory or

170
00:09:29.730 --> 00:09:31.920
the things that we sell in our pet store.

171
00:09:31.920 --> 00:09:35.250
So you see how I have a tab for
dogs, and I've got their breed and

172
00:09:35.250 --> 00:09:40.090
what they cost us and what we're gonna
sell them for, I've got miscellaneous,

173
00:09:40.090 --> 00:09:42.250
some hamsters and guinea pigs.

174
00:09:42.250 --> 00:09:44.970
We've got birds and we've got cats.

175
00:09:44.970 --> 00:09:48.340
Well, now I want to
start selling reptiles.

176
00:09:48.340 --> 00:09:52.500
So that means I need somewhere to store
the information about the reptiles.

177
00:09:52.500 --> 00:09:53.890
Where do I do that?

178
00:09:53.890 --> 00:09:56.360
That's this little button right down here.

179
00:09:56.360 --> 00:09:59.500
You hover it, you see it says, New Sheet.

180
00:09:59.500 --> 00:10:05.770
So I can simply click that New Sheet
button and now I have a new sheet.

181
00:10:05.770 --> 00:10:10.590
Now, we can rename new sheets by
double-clicking on the tab for

182
00:10:10.590 --> 00:10:12.490
the sheet itself and you can see the name.

183
00:10:12.490 --> 00:10:16.930
Now sheet one is highlighted and
I'll just start typing or

184
00:10:16.930 --> 00:10:18.149
replace that with Reptiles.

185
00:10:19.450 --> 00:10:23.240
All right, and now I've got a sheet
where I can start tracking reptiles,

186
00:10:23.240 --> 00:10:26.050
so adding a new sheet to
a workbook is simple.

187
00:10:26.050 --> 00:10:27.508
You just click the plus sign and

188
00:10:27.508 --> 00:10:32.180
then rename the sheet to whatever
you want that sheet to be called.

189
00:10:32.180 --> 00:10:34.340
Now, we can also delete sheets.

190
00:10:34.340 --> 00:10:36.790
Maybe we add a couple too many.

191
00:10:36.790 --> 00:10:38.620
We thought we were gonna need more.

192
00:10:38.620 --> 00:10:40.050
And now we realize we don't need them, so

193
00:10:40.050 --> 00:10:43.366
I've just got these blank worksheets in my
workbook and I want to get rid of them.

194
00:10:43.366 --> 00:10:45.013
Easy enough.

195
00:10:45.013 --> 00:10:50.970
Right-click on that tab and choose Delete,
and that sheet will go away.

196
00:10:50.970 --> 00:10:52.570
Now something to keep in mind.

197
00:10:52.570 --> 00:10:57.520
If this worksheet has data in it and
you go

198
00:10:57.520 --> 00:11:00.700
to delete that worksheet,
it will warn you.

199
00:11:00.700 --> 00:11:05.940
It will permanently delete this sheet and
all data will be lost.

200
00:11:05.940 --> 00:11:07.332
Do you wanna continue?

201
00:11:07.332 --> 00:11:11.390
Gives you that once chance,
once you click Delete, that's it.

202
00:11:11.390 --> 00:11:11.930
It's gone.

203
00:11:11.930 --> 00:11:12.590
All right.

204
00:11:12.590 --> 00:11:14.040
Do be careful with that.

205
00:11:14.040 --> 00:11:15.640
If it's a blank sheet, no big deal.

206
00:11:15.640 --> 00:11:17.250
I can always add another sheet.

207
00:11:17.250 --> 00:11:19.920
But if there was data on there,
that data's lost.

208
00:11:19.920 --> 00:11:23.090
So do be careful with the whole
deleting of the worksheets.

209
00:11:24.520 --> 00:11:26.460
So easy enough to add additional sheets.

210
00:11:26.460 --> 00:11:28.350
And let's go ahead and let's see.

211
00:11:28.350 --> 00:11:31.270
I'm going to fill some of this out.

212
00:11:31.270 --> 00:11:36.460
And I'll show you guys some of
these tricks as we go through.

213
00:11:36.460 --> 00:11:38.060
Good golly, Mike.

214
00:11:38.060 --> 00:11:41.130
There we go.
We're gonna go over here and put our

215
00:11:41.130 --> 00:11:48.160
Reptiles and let's say we want to sell
boa constrictors and I don't know.

216
00:11:48.160 --> 00:11:50.880
Ronnie, do you have any idea
what a boa constrictor goes for?

217
